summary: This bill, the "Temporary Extension of Fentanyl-Related Substances Scheduling Act," proposes to extend the temporary scheduling order for fentanyl-related substances for an additional six months. The bill amends a previous act (Public Law 116–114) by changing the expiration date from March 31, 2025, to September 30, 2025. This action is intended to maintain the temporary legal controls over fentanyl-related substances.
